sections.title: Spices Board Registration - Overview
sections.text: The spices board of india acts as a regulatory body in charge of promoting Indian spices in the foreign market. It is a division of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry. It served as a conduit between foreign buyers and Indian spice suppliers.

It is mandatory to have a spices board registration certificate  with the masala board for every producer or a businessperson who deals with exports with spices. Moreover, the Spices Board Act of 1986 mandates the incorporation certificate to conduct the import and export formalities. If anyone involved in the trading of the spices without the spice board certificate may be arrested and imprisoned for upto a year

sections.title: Who Should Have Access to the Spices Board of India - CRES?
sections.text: Anyone who exports the 52 specified spices and cardamom must get the Spice Board's Certificate of Registration as Exporter of Spices (CRES), whether they are a manufacturer or a retailer.

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria for Spice Board Registration
sections.text: The Spices Board of India has established eligibility criteria for spice exporters and manufacturers to register with them. The eligibility criteria are as follows:
sections.items: The exporter or manufacturer must be a registered entity under the Companies Act, 1956, or the Partnership Act of 1932 | The exporter or manufacturer must have a valid Import-Export (IE) Code issued by the Directorate General of Foreign Trade | The exporter or manufacturer must have a minimum turnover of ₹2.5 lakhs for the previous financial year | The exporter or manufacturer must have a permanent place of business and adequate storage facilities for spices | The exporter or manufacturer must have the necessary infrastructure, technical know-how, and quality control systems to ensure the production of high-quality spices | The exporter or manufacturer must comply with the food safety and quality standards prescribed by the Spices Board | The exporter or manufacturer must agree to follow the guidelines and procedures prescribed by the Spices Board for the export or manufacture of spices.

sections.text: Meeting these eligibility criteria for spice board registration is necessary to register with the Spices Board and ensure compliance with the regulations of the board.

sections.title: Penalty for Violation of Spice Board Certificate
sections.text: The spice board of India is responsible for the regulation and promotion of Indian spices. The board issues certificates to exporters, which are required for the export of spices from India. Violation of a spice board certificate can result in penalties and consequences. The penalties for violation of a spice board certificate may vary depending on the nature of the violation. Some possible penalties may include:
Fine: The spice board may impose a fine on ₹1000 when the exporter for the violation of the certificate
Suspension or Cancellation of Certificate:The spice board may suspend or cancel the certificate of the exporter if the violation is severe or repeated
Blacklisting: In some cases, the spice board may blacklist the exporter, preventing them from exporting spices from India in the future
Legal action: The spice board may take legal action against the exporter for violating the regulations.

sections.title: CRES Validity Time Period
sections.text: The Board may from time to time announce block periods of ‘three years’ during which the certificate of registration as an exporter will be given. The block year in use is ‘2017 to 2020’. The spice board certificate has to be renewed at the end of each block year.

sections.title: Spices Board Registration Renewal
sections.text: Spices Board Registration Renewal is the process of renewing the registration of spice exporters and spice manufacturers with the Spices Board of India. The Spices Board is a government agency responsible for the development and promotion of spices in India and abroad.

All spice exporters and manufacturers are required to register with the Spices Board to ensure the quality and safety of their products. The initial registration is valid for three years, after which it must be renewed to continue the registration.

During the spices board registration renewal process, the exporter or manufacturer must submit the necessary documents and pay the prescribed fee to the Spices Board. The spices board registration renewal is essential for the exporter or manufacturer to continue exporting or manufacturing spices and to maintain compliance with the regulations of the Spices Board.

items.question: What are the penalties applicable for violating the provisions set by the Spice Board?
items.answer:
The following Penalties would be implied in the event that any conditions prohibiting the start of trading without receiving the Spice Board Certification were broken:
  • Imprisonment that might last for a year
  • Up to ₹1000 may be assessed as a fine.

items.question: When was the spice board enacted?
items.answer: The erstwhile Cardamom Board, founded in 1968, and the Spices Export Promotion Council, founded in 1960, were combined to form the Spice Board of India, which was constituted on 26 February 1987, in accordance with the Spice Board Act, 1986.

items.question: How to pay the fee for spice board registration?
items.answer: To pay the fee for spice board registration, an exporter can make an online payment through the spice board's website using a credit card, debit card, or net banking. The exporter can also make a demand draft in favour of the Spice Board and send it to the appropriate office.

items.question: Is the certificate of spice board registration cancelled?
items.answer: Yes, the certificate of spice board registration can be cancelled or suspended if an exporter violates the regulations set by the board. The extent and severity of the violation will determine whether the certificate is cancelled or suspended, and the exporter may face penalties or legal action.

items.question: Are CRES and spice board registration the same?
items.answer: No, CRES (Certificate of Registration as Exporter of Spices) and spice board registration are not the same. CRES is issued by the Director General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) and is required for export of all goods, including spices, from India, while spice board registration is specifically for spice exporters and is issued by the spice board of India.

items.question: After Having IEC and Spices Board Registration, Can We Start to Export Spices?
items.answer: After obtaining the IEC (Import Export Code) and spice board registration, an exporter can start exporting spices from India. However, the exporter must comply with the regulations set by both the DGFT and the spice board to ensure smooth and legal export of spices.

items.question: What is a certificate from the masala/spice board?
items.answer: The Spices Board's Certificate of Registration of Exporters of Spices (CRES) is a certificate that verifies an exporter who deals in a specific product is registered with a specific agency or authority that has been granted permission by the Indian government to conduct export and import.

items.question: What purpose does a spice board of India serve?
items.answer: Development of small and large export firms, promotion, development, regulation of the export of spices, and control over the quality of spices for export are among the Board's main responsibilities. Under the observation of the Indian Cardamom Research Institute, the Spices Board of India also conducts research on cardamom (both small and large).

items.question: Is registration with the Masala/Spice Board Mandatory?
items.answer: Yes, in addition to the IEC, a certificate of registration as an Exporter of Spices issued by the board is required for the export or import of spices or products containing spices. Under Section 11 of the Spices Board Act, the Spices Board issues Certificates of Registration as Exporters of Spices (CRES) to the business owners.

items.answer: Once all information has been filled out and uploaded, payment is required. All changes to the application form must be made prior to payment. New factory registration costs ₹15,000 plus 18% GST, while new merchant registration costs ₹10,000 plus 18% GST.

items.question: What is the validity of the spice board registration certificate?
items.answer: The initial registration certificate issued by the Spices Board of India is valid for three years from the date of issue. After the expiry of the initial registration certificate, it can be renewed for a further period of three years by submitting the necessary documents and fees to the Spices Board. Therefore, the validity of the spice board registration certificate is three years, which can be renewed for an additional three years.

items.question: What is the procedure for spices board registration renewal?
items.answer: The Spices Board of India requires all registered spice exporters and manufacturers to renew their registration every three years to maintain compliance with the regulations of the board. The procedure for Spice Board Registration Renewal involves submitting an application form, providing the necessary documents, and paying the renewal fee to the Spices Board.
